 determines if the keyboard key was pressed this frame

 determines if the keyboard key was released this frame
eolBool eol_input_is_key_held (eolInt key)
 determines if the keyboard key is held during this frame
eolBool eol_input_is_mod_held (eolUint mod)
 determines if the keyboard modifier key is held during this frame Uses SDLMod enumerations, ex: KMOD_LSHIFT, KMOD_ALT, etc.
eolBool eol_input_is_mod_pressed (eolUint mod)
 determines if the keyboard modifier key is pressed during this frame Uses SDLMod enumerations, ex: KMOD_LSHIFT, KMOD_ALT, etc.
eolBool eol_input_is_mod_released (eolUint mod)
 determines if the keyboard modifier key is released during this frame Uses SDLMod enumerations, ex: KMOD_LSHIFT, KMOD_ALT, etc.

eolBool eol_input_is_input_down (char *input)
 determines the if the named input is in a down state at the point of this call.
eolBool eol_input_is_input_held (char *input)
 determines the if the named input has been down continuously for set period of time. the held threshold is configureable.
eolBool eol_input_is_input_pressed (char *input)
 determines the if the named input was just pressed this frame
eolBool eol_input_is_input_released (char *input)
 determines the if the named input was just released this frame
eolBool eol_input_is_input_double_tapped (char *input)
 determines the if the named input was tapped twice in rapid succession. The threshold for "double tap" is configurable
void eol_input_update ()
 updated internal input states. This need to be called every frame or as often as you need your inputs updated.
eolFloat eol_get_input_value (char *input)
 return the value of the input specified. This is useful for analog control types such as a joystick's X axis.
void eol_input_load_config ()
 load the input system configuration and input mappings from files. If no files found, load defaults.
eolBool eol_input_quit_check ()
 checks for any quit condition from the user.
